description: Automated reporting system compiling data into structured reports.

resource: Resources for researching and understanding Wet'suwet'en Title & History
description: Overarching recommendation made and links provided to historical context on Wet'suwet'en land title and territories through Delgamuukw transcripts at https://open.library.ubc.ca/collections/delgamuukw.

Collaborative mapping application for phone and personal computers with floodplain modeling, surveyed routes, prescriptions, water quality sites, fencing sites, UAV imagery, lidar, and scripts for QGIS. conatact al@newgraphenvironment.com for access. Also see Table 4.1 - https://www.newgraphenvironment.com/restoration_wedzin_kwa_2024/results.html#collaborative-gis-environment-1
Public repository containing scripts and tools used for data processing, analysis and reporting.

resource: UAV Imagery Viewer and Download Links
description: Platform for viewing and downloading UAV imagery, with instructions for QGIS integration.
Visualization and export of details of historic ortho-images overlapping the study area.
Demonstrates use of lidar on iPhones to gather vegetation monitoring information related to restoration prescription implementation and the open sharing of that data.
Leveraging other knowledge hubs with interactive tables and functions for viewing and downloading reports and spatial files.
Downloadable reference file in format that can be leveraged to add all items to users' collection with Zotero or Mendeley.
Visualize and quantify remotely sense land cover data for a study area of interest. Can be used in change analysis from historic conditions, impact assessment and restoration monitoring.

Visualize and quantify remotely sensed precipitation data for a study area of interest. Can be used to characterize study period against historic conditions. Climate anamoly information can also be evaluated for custom study areas through https://github.com/NewGraphEnvironment/bc_climate_anomaly/tree/newgraph

resource: Custom R Packages and code repositories
description: Open-source tools with documentation to facilitate data analysis, reporting, and GIS work.
CSV containing additional restoration-related datasets and references.
